str2: And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Second; with the article: in the second place, for the second time. As the compare of duo; second.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sound a trumpet. From salpigx; to trumpet, i.e. Sound a blast.
And, even, also, namely.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To ignite, light, burn, lit. and met; I consume with fire. Apparently a primary verb; to set on fire, i.e. Kindle or consume.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Third. Ordinal from treis; third; neuter a third part, or a third time, thirdly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
